sentences: After attending college, she worked various jobs, including as a secretary (including at the BBC in New York), dancer, and Playboy Bunny, before breaking through in the music industry.

sentences: The band released their eponymous debut album in 1976, and released a further three albums between then and 1979, including Parallel Lines, which spawned six singles, including "Heart of Glass".

sentences: In 1981, Harry released her debut solo album, KooKoo, and, during a hiatus of Blondie, embarked on an acting career, appearing in lead roles in the neo-noir Union City (1980) and in David Cronenberg's body horror film Videodrome (1983).

sentences: Harry was born Angela Trimble on July 1, 1945, in Miami, Florida.
section: == Life and career == | === 1945–1965: Early life ===

sentences: At the age of three months, she was adopted by Catherine (née Peters) and Richard Harry, gift shop proprietors in Hawthorne, New Jersey, and renamed Deborah Ann Harry.
section: == Life and career == | === 1945–1965: Early life ===

sentences: Harry learned of her adoption at four years old.
section: == Life and career == | === 1945–1965: Early life ===

sentences: Initially deciding against locating her birth parents,  she located her birth mother, a concert pianist, in the late 1980s,  who chose not to establish a relationship with Harry.
section: == Life and career == | === 1945–1965: Early life ===

sentences: In her memoir, she recalls being a tomboy, spending much of her childhood playing in the woods adjacent to her home.
section: == Life and career == | === 1945–1965: Early life ===

sentences: Harry attended Hawthorne High School, graduating in 1963.
section: == Life and career == | === 1945–1965: Early life ===

sentences: She graduated from Centenary College in Hackettstown, New Jersey, with an Associate of Arts degree in 1965.
section: == Life and career == | === 1945–1965: Early life ===

sentences: Before beginning her singing career, she moved to New York City in the late 1960s, and worked there as a secretary at BBC Radio's office for one year.
section: == Life and career == | === 1945–1965: Early life ===

sentences: Later, she was a waitress at Max's Kansas City, a go-go dancer in a discothèque in Union City, New Jersey, and a Playboy Bunny.

== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Harry was in a relationship with the Blondie guitarist Chris Stein.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: The pair split up in 1987, but remained friends.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In 2011, Harry admitted that she and Stein were both drug users during their relationship, but added that they had spent time in a rehabilitation clinic and no longer used drugs.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Harry is godmother to Stein's two daughters.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In 2014, Harry revealed that she had had several relationships with women in her youth.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In her 2019 memoir, Face It, Harry describes having been raped at knifepoint during a burglary of the home she shared with Stein.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: She also wrote in Face It that during the early 1970s, the serial killer Ted Bundy lured her into his car in New York City, but she escaped.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Harry's description of the white vehicle stripped on the inside and missing the passenger door handle matched the 1968 VW Bundy was driving, but authorities believed him to be in Florida at the time.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Ann Rule, an author of the Bundy biography The Stranger Beside Me, commented that erroneous claims of Bundy abductions are not uncommon.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: As of 2019, Harry lives part-time in New York City and part-time in Monmouth County, New Jersey, together with her four dogs.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Philanthropy ==
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: In a 2011 interview, Harry said that "After witnessing Elton John and his tireless efforts against HIV/AIDS", she had been inspired to make philanthropy her top priority.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: She said, "These things are important to my life now.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: I have the privilege of being able to get involved, so I do.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: I applaud people like Elton John, who have used their position to do so much good."
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: Some of Harry's preferred charities include those devoted to fighting cancer and endometriosis.
